kickstart.description: Lifemapper roll (lmcompute) Install on the frontend of the lmcompute cluster.

kickstart.post:
ID=`/bin/egrep -i "^lmwriter" /etc/group` if [ "$ID" == "" ] ; then # adding lmwriter user with group /usr/sbin/useradd -c "Lifemapper user" lmwriter else # adding lmwriter user, group already exists /usr/sbin/useradd -c "Lifemapper user" -g lmwriter lmwriter fi
mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/jobs mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/metrics mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/temp mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/logs mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/dailyLogs mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/data/layers mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/test
mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/jobRequests mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/holdJobs mkdir -p /state/partition1/lm/pushJobs
/bin/cp -p -r /opt/lifemapper/LmCompute/test/* /state/partition1/lm/test chgrp -R lmwriter /state/partition1/lm chmod -R g+ws /state/partition1/lm
# these directories allow lock files on each node, lmwriter must have rw mkdir /opt/lifemapper/.java mkdir /opt/lifemapper/.java/.systemPrefs mkdir /opt/lifemapper/.java/.userPrefs
# these commands do the same changes as lifemapper-server roll # need if both rolls are on the same server /bin/chgrp lmwriter /opt/lifemapper /bin/chmod g+ws /opt/lifemapper
for item in ".java" "config" "Lm*" "__init__.py*" ; do /bin/chgrp -R lmwriter /opt/lifemapper/$item /bin/chmod -R g+ws /opt/lifemapper/$item done
# Mounts /export/lm to /share/lm
lm &Kickstart_PrivateHostname;:/export/&
/etc/init.d/autofs restart /opt/rocks/bin/rocks sync users /opt/rocks/bin/rocks run host compute "service autofs restart"
